an7.64:4.1: “Mendicants, these seven things that please and assist an enemy happen to an angry man or woman.
an7.64:4.3: Firstly, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:4.6: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have a beautiful enemy.
an7.64:4.7: “An angry person, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, is ugly, even though they’re nicely bathed and anointed, with hair and beard dressed, and wearing white clothes.
an7.64:4.9: This is the first thing that pleases and assists an enemy which happens to an angry man or woman.
an7.64:5.1: Furthermore, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:5.4: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have an enemy who sleeps well.
an7.64:5.5: An angry person, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, sleeps badly, even though they sleep on a couch spread with woolen covers—shag-piled, pure white, or embroidered with flowers—and spread with a fine deer hide, with a canopy above and red pillows at both ends.
an7.64:6.1: Furthermore, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:6.2: ‘If only they don’t get all they need!’
an7.64:6.4: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have an enemy who gets all they need.
an7.64:6.5: When an angry person, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, gets what they don’t need they think ‘I’ve got what I need!’ When they get what they need they think ‘I’ve got what I don’t need.’
an7.64:6.6: When an angry person get these things that are the exact opposite of what they need, it’s for their lasting harm and suffering
an7.64:7.1: Furthermore, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:7.4: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have an enemy who is wealthy.
an7.64:7.5: When a person is angry, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, the rulers seize the legitimate wealth they’ve earned by their efforts, built up with their own hands, gathered by the sweat of the brow.
an7.64:8.1: Furthermore, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:8.4: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have a famous enemy.
an7.64:8.5: When a person is angry, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, any fame they have acquired by diligence falls to dust.
an7.64:9.1: Furthermore, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:9.4: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have an enemy with friends.
an7.64:9.5: When a person is angry, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, their friends and colleagues, relatives and kin avoid them from afar.
an7.64:10.1: Furthermore, an enemy wishes for an enemy:
an7.64:10.2: ‘If only, when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell!’
an7.64:10.4: Because an enemy doesn’t like to have an enemy who goes to a good place.
an7.64:10.5: When a person is angry, overcome and overwhelmed by anger, they do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
an7.64:10.7: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
an7.64:10.8: This is the seventh thing that pleases and assists an enemy which happens to an angry man or woman.
an7.64:11.1: These are the seven things that please and assist an enemy which happen to an angry man or woman.”
an7.64:12.3: When they get what they need,
an7.64:12.4: they take it to be what they don’t need.
an7.64:16.1: An angry person doesn’t know the good.
an7.64:16.2: An angry person doesn’t see the truth.
an7.64:16.3: When a person is beset by anger,
an7.64:17.1: An angry person destroys with ease
an7.64:17.3: Afterwards, when the anger is spent,
an7.64:17.4: they’re tormented as if burnt by fire.
an7.64:18.3: And when their anger flares up,
an7.64:19.1: They have no conscience or prudence,
an7.64:20.1: The deeds that torment a man
an7.64:20.2: are far from those that are good.
an7.64:20.4: listen to this, for it is the truth.
an7.64:21.1: An angry person slays their father;
an7.64:21.3: An angry person slays a saint;
an7.64:21.4: a normal person, too, they slay.
an7.64:22.1: A man is raised by his mother,
an7.64:22.3: But an angry ordinary person slays
an7.64:22.4: even that good woman who gave him life.
an7.64:23.3: But angry people kill themselves all kinds of ways,
an7.64:24.4: or fling themselves down a mountain gorge.
an7.64:25.1: When they commit deeds of destroying life
an7.64:25.3: they don’t realize what they do,
an7.64:25.4: for anger leads them to ruin.
an7.64:26.1: The snare of death in the form of anger
an7.64:26.3: You should cut it out by self-control,
an7.64:26.4: by wisdom, energy, and right ideas.
an7.64:27.3: And they’d train in the teaching in just the same way,
an7.64:28.1: Free of anger, with no more despair,
an7.64:28.2: free of greed, with no more longing,
